conclusion: Determine the distance traveled by the car within 60 seconds using the acceleration-time graph.
The graph shows two periods of constant acceleration: 2 m/s² from 0 to 30 seconds and -1 m/s² from 30 to 60 seconds.
Initial velocity v0 is 0 since the car starts from rest.
Calculate velocity at t = 30 seconds: v30 = 60 m/s.
Calculate velocity at t = 60 seconds: v60 = 30 m/s.
Calculate distance from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds: s0-30 = 900 m.
Calculate distance from t = 30 to t = 60 seconds: s30-60 = 1350 m.
Total distance traveled is s_total = 2250 m.
The distance traveled by the car within 60 seconds is 2250 m.
